subject: Wild Cards RPG
event:
For the Wild Cards fans among you -- we're just announced a new deal with Green Ronin Games for a new WILD CARDS rpg.  John Miller will be writing the campaign setting.  Details on the Green Ronin website, my own website news page, and soon on John's live journal, I'm sure.

WILD CARDS originally grew out of a role-playing game called SUPERWORLD, so in a sense we're going home again.  I'm sure that John will do a great job... and Green Ronin makes some seriously cool games.

comments.article: Awesome. Green Ronin are an excellent company; small, innovative, and consistent in producing quality products (like the Mutants&Masterminds line).
And I see, M&M is what this will be based on. Even better. :)

Very cool.  I'm currently playing in a GURPS Wild Cards game(though we played fast-and-loose with the storyline).  I'm a little skeptical about the D20 style from a flexibility standpoint, but I'll try to keep an open mind.  The world is just so open-ended and rich that I have a hard time imagining that it will be good in a less open-ended system.

I wanted to comment on your "What I'm Reading" section, I've never posted before, but when my favorite author is reading my second favorite author, I have to.  I just had to tell you you have to read Jacqueline Carey's Kushiel series, besides Ice & Fire, they are the only series I have re-read at least 3 times.  Looking forward to Dance With Dragons, take as long as you need.
comments.subject: What You're Reading

comments.article: I have the GURPS Wildcard game on my bookshelf, can't wait for a new version!

You too huh? :p

I haven't played D20 before - not even for the ASOIAF game, sad to relate. But I will definitely be buying this... even if I never got a chance to play it, I'd buy it. (But I will. Oh, I will.)
Great news!  Green Ronin is doing some incredible stuff with Mutants and Masterminds; couldn't have picked a better company to go with.

Yes, M&M Second Edition Rawks.

PS: You cannot escape me, Godfish!

Hey take your time George with the Book. Like I tell my shop guys a little extra work produces a better product. Anyhow This is off topic but I have to know with such love of Football who do you root for in College ball? Pleaseeeee don't Say USC
comments.subject: Ello there

comments.article:
Go Blue! (As a member of the Michigan Marching Band I'm required to preface all football related statements with that, you understand I'm sure)

Anyways, I'm pretty excited to see how Green Ronin handles this, if it's as good as their other work (and I dont know why it wouldn't be) I will be a very happy camper.
comments.subject: Re: Ello there

comments.article: What are you reading at the moment, Ser Martin? Have you read any cool graphic novels recently? How about other authors' fantasy works? Have you thought about selling the rights of some of your characters to comic book companies? Y'know, like Origin of the Hound or something?
comments.subject: Speaking of Comics.......

comments.article: Are you familiar with the Hedge Knight comics?  If not, it's exactly what you're looking for.  They are currently producing the second series, based on GRRM's novella "The Sworn Sword", with the first series, based on "The Hedge Knight", already available as a graphic novel.
comments.subject: Re: Speaking of Comics.......

comments.article: This is too awesome!
comments.subject: YAY!!!

comments.article:
George ! Green Ronin is a great company, I think you did a good job picking them to do your sourcebooks. I bout the Gaurdians of order Game of thrones book and it was incredible ! I ran a campaign set 50 or so years before the conquest. Here is our website, I called it War of the Ironborn.
http://z7.invisionfree.com/AGOT_RPG/index.php?showtopic=230

Thanks for the hours of incredible reading you have given me. I've read the series like 9 times now. I'm looking forward to listening to them on DVD or CD soon. I dont have a cassette player, they need to put em on CD's !!!
Later you mad scrivener you !
Mike Ceranko
comments.subject: RPG

comments.article:
I'd love to try, but my bf tried to get me into RPGs but I am completely RPG inept.

That's my story and I'm sticking to it. :)
sweet.

comments.upictitle: J.A.C.K. Inc.  Super Secret Ninja Force: chiburi
comments.article: This sounds very exciting.  I can't wait to hear more.
Hmmm.... to continue converting Champions to WildCards or to wait for WildCards to come out in the next year or so... Now I have a problem to ponder.

Hear that noise? Its the sound of Steve Jackson rolling over in his grave...

Wait, Evil Stevie is alive!
Hi, I've never posted here before, and I by no means wish to slam you or anything, but I was wondering if you have a rough estimate of when Dance will be out?  Just curious and eager to read it :)
comments.subject: Hello

comments.article:
when it is done.

When it is done, George will post announcements on his web site, this LJ and it will spread to the message boards and ripple outward.

Until then, don't expect updates on progress on DANCE.
comments.subject: it will be done

comments.article:
I <3 GRRM!!!!

I don't care if DANCE takes 15 years, you always do such a good job and I trust you!
comments.subject: Dancy Dance!

comments.article:
I'll be interested to see what effect the newly announced D&D 4th edition has on both of these projects, especially ASoIaF. Here's hoping Wizards doesn't do anything stupid like revoking or changing the OGL and shooting all our dreams to $#!7....

Anyway it's a darn shame that Green Ronin can't use the system they developed for WFRP. That would be perfect for the gritty world of Westeros.
Where can one get new copies of the earlier books in the Wild Cards series? I'm interested in giving it a chance but I don't know where to look for new copies on the internet.
comments.subject: Question about Wild Cards...

comments.article: I think it would be nice if you could get someone to fix the "Santa Fe" (Life and Times) section of your web-site.  I'm really interested to see if anything about Roger Zelazny is in there, because I'm a big fan, and I know you were good friends.  Thanks a lot.  I know you're busy, so you can take your time.
comments.subject: Sorta off topic...

comments.article: I'd love to see some Wild Cards single person RPGs...like the old Lone Wolf or Fighting Fantasy adventures. Sometimes its just so hard to get a group together to play!
Sweeeeeeeeeet.  I love Wildcards.  *rocks*
Any chance of updating the "what I'm reading" section, you already got me hooked on some other authors to fill the void until dance comes out. Please can we have some more? Tony, Brisbane, Australia.

1. Is there anything in the works for a computer based RPG for any of your series?
2. I understand Wild Cards is like into its gajillionth book and many of them are out of print. Where should I start if I wanted to get into the series today?

Thanks for keeping in touch with your fans. Talk to you later.

Zeb
comments.subject: A couple of Q's

comments.article:
Used copies of the first dozen books are vey easy to find. Check eBay, Amazon.com, and abebooks.com.

The Baen books are tougher, with the third book being especially tough. The two iBooks are still available in small numbers now, and if you are at interested in completeing the series, get these asap. You might not want to read them out of sequence, but get copies for later.

John Jos. Miller
__________________________________________________________________________
Currently reading: You mean, besides all the wild card books?

Currently writing: The complete history of the wild card universe. Fortunately it is contained in only seventeen original volumes.

In the Publishers Pipeline: Graphic adaptation of George R.R. Martin's "In the House of the Worm" for Avatar Comics. "Wakes the Lion" for INSIDE STRAIGHT. "Mortality's Strong Hand" for BUSTED FLUSH.
comments.subject: Re: A couple of Q's

comments.article: Talked to them at Gen Con and they said the AGoT system would be very easy to learn. I'm sold.
comments.subject: Green Ronin

comments.article:
Hello Mr. Martin,

Firstly, thank you.

Second, I should say I've wanted to write this for over a year now but I don't really write these kinds of things, and yet every time you mention A Dance with Dragons you sound disgusted with the feedback. So I wanted to throw my two cents in.

I love your writing. Philosophy and such might be the main course I need to survive but it's fantasy that tastes the sweetest. And between you and Robert Jordan I am ruined for all other fantasy. I've tried. Seriously, it's a line most times I wish I hadn't crossed. And you take so long, the both of you, that most days it's excruciating. But I wouldn't want you to change a thing. If you take 5 years to make A Dance with Dragons, that was how long it took to make it right. You don't fuck with genius, pardon my french, and you don't ask Mozart to write faster. Whatever you're doing works so well I'd have to agree you've "elevated the fantasy genre to prose", and I hope you don't ever feel pressured to rush. They're just kids who want their sweets early anyway.

Deepest thanks,
Charles
comments.subject: Deadlines
